item.title: Robots at Midnight coming to PS5 on August 28
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Currently available for Xbox Series and PC.

Publisher Snail and developer Finish Line Games will release action RPG Robots at Midnight for PlayStation 5 on August 28, the companies announced.

Robots at Midnight first launched for Xbox Series and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on June 19.

“We love Soulslike action, but we wanted to offer a combat-heavy rewarding experience that didn’t wallow in doom and gloom, with a more vibrant, colorful world to explore,” said Finish Line Games co-founder Daniel Posner in a press release. “We can’t wait for PlayStation players to experience it!”

Here is an overview of the game, via Finish Line Games:

About

Robots at Midnight is a retro-futuristic action RPG set on the planet Yob, a world left in ruins and haunted by the machines once built to serve it.

After twenty years in cryo-sleep, Zoe wakes to find a world she barely recognizes. To survive and to save what’s left, she must track down her missing father, lost during the cataclysmic event known only as The Blackout. Along the way, she’ll take on gangs of corrupted robots, confront towering bosses, and uncover long-buried truths about Yob.

Just be home before midnight.

Key Features

  • Combat with Fluid Movement – The MITT is a powerful piece of old-world tech made for Space exploration, now repurposed for survival. Launch off enemies, soar through the air, and smash through bots with momentum-based combat that keeps you constantly moving. Whether in battle or traversal, fast, fluid movement is your greatest weapon. Find your rhythm. Sharpen your skills. Discover what you’re really made of.
  • Choose Your Challenge – Whether you’re new to action RPGs or a seasoned fighter, Robots at Midnight adapts to your playstyle. Hero Mode offers a more forgiving, story-driven experience, while Master Mode pushes your reflexes and tactics to the edge with high-stakes combat. Whichever path you choose, prepare for a fight.
  • Explore and Uncover Hidden Lore – Waking up on a ruined planet isn’t the hard part, figuring out what happened is. Step into Zoe’s sneakers and investigate the mystery behind Yob’s downfall. Discover lost technologies, unravel the threads of the past, and determine your place in a future that moved on without you.

item.title: Fast-paced first-person shooter VEX MAGE announced for PC, Quest
item.content:encoded:
Playable in flat screen and virtual reality modes.

Publisher Fast Travel Games and developer Nervous Systems have announced VEX MAGE, a fast-paced first-person shooter playable in both flat screen and virtual reality modes. It will be available for PC via Steam and Quest. A release date was not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Twin elements. Infinite momentum. Danger from every direction.

Merge spells, cross dimensions, and dance through deadly arenas in this lightning-fast shooter. Alone or together—claim your immortality on cross-platform leaderboards. Your name is eternal.

Key Features

  • Vexatious Combat – Enemies strike from all sides—survive by mastering your movement and aggression.
  • Combine the Elements – Assign elemental runes to each hand and fuse them for devastating results.
  • Fast-Fire Sessions – Dive into a rapid-fire campaign of levels that explode with speed, chaos, and pure adrenaline.
  • Cooperative and Solo – Fight alone or with up to two allies. The challenge adapts, so every run is a test of survival.
  • Global Leaderboards – Leave your mark—fight your way up the global leaderboards, where only the deadliest rise to the top.
  • Optional Virtual Reality Support – Unleash all six degrees of freedom and experience deeper immersion through first-class virtual reality support.
  • Cross-Platform – Seamlessly play and compete with players from the Meta Quest Platform.
